meanings.definition: A temporary work stoppage or denial of employment initiated by an employer during a labor dispute.
meanings.sent1: The lockout caused the employees to stay outside the factory.
meanings.sent2: The lockout lasted for a week before the issue was resolved.
meanings.sent3: During the lockout, the workers organized a picnic outside the workplace.
meanings.sent4: The lockout was like a barrier preventing the workers from entering the building.
meanings.sent5: The lockout created tension between the management and the employees.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing access to a place or system by using a lock or other security measure.
meanings.sent1: The lockout of the room was necessary to keep valuable items safe.
meanings.sent2: He experienced a lockout when he forgot the password to his computer.
meanings.sent3: The lockout of the house led to a funny situation when no one could enter.
meanings.sent4: The lockout on the gate was a strong deterrent for intruders.
meanings.sent5: The lockout of the system was so secure that even the owner had trouble accessing it.
